Ron,
Probably not Kyo-Shoami given the lack of marubori elements and/or nunome zogan.  Shoami if Edo period or Ko-Shoami if pre-Edo -- at least that is my interpretation of your guard based on my knowledge of the current kantei conventions.  

3.5 mm is rather thick for early Onin work, although the surface of the plate does look old.  John's guard looks younger than yours in both the plate and the inlay style.
Jim

  Jim/John/Gents:

  Thanks very much for the help!
  Kyo-Shoami it is on the sukashi guard.

  On the other, Onin makes absolute sense..and the pics of John's 
  tsuba look right on (plate and ring)
  Btw, the rim is 3.5 mm and is uniform on the Onin tsuba..

  Thanks again,
  Ron P.
